result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua W. Helgemo in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
9:08 a.m. Court calls the case and states appearances.
Cases heard today 16CM369, 16CT93, 16CM120

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM369 both counts: GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CM369 both counts.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
16CT93 & 16CM120 are dismissed and read-in.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
16CM369 Count 1
Pay $100 plus DNA surcharge
4 days jail with 4 days credit
Bond to be applied
Pay in 60 days or setup a payment plan today

Count 2
Pay $100 plus DNA surcharge
4 days jail concurrent with 4 days credit
Bond to be applied
Pay in 60 days or setup a payment plan today

Court advises of post-conviction rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 11, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Joshua W. Helgemo in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Not to commit any new crimes.

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Obstructing an Officer.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  3/21/16  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
